item.title: Viva add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Viva add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Trust me, I'm telling you stories." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Viva add a quote by Czesław Miłosz
item.description:
"Learning
To believe you are magnificent. And gradually to discover that you are not magnificent. Enough labor for one human life." -- Czesław Miłosz

item.title: Viva add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape." -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Viva add a quote by Marion Zimmer Bradley
item.description: "By what men think, we create the world around us, daily new." -- Marion Zimmer Bradley

item.title: Viva add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "We can't behave like people in novels, though, can we?" -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Viva add a quote by M.J. Andersen
item.description: "Anyone who tells you her life is like a book has either been reading some bad books or is not being straight with you or herself about her life." -- M.J. Andersen

item.title: Viva add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Viva add a quote by Diana Abu-Jaber
item.description: "Let the beauty we love be what we do. There are a hundred ways to kneel and kiss the ground" -- Diana Abu-Jaber

item.title: Viva add a quote by Rumer Godden
item.description: "On and off, all that hot French August, we made ourselves ill from eating the greengages. Joss and I felt guilty; we were still at the age when we thought being greedy was a childish fault and this gave our guilt a tinge of hopelessness because, up to then, we had believed that as we grew older our faults would disappear, and none of them did." -- Rumer Godden
